intro: Orchis ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow orchis, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stem and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in woodland areas. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces a single spike of flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The yellow orchis is also known for its role in supporting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
